NATS
National Airspace Trajectory-Prediction System
NATS Documentation

NATS API is a library collection developed in Java and C/C++ technology to provide aircraft trajectory prediction functionality. The design objective is to provide a simulation environment for multiple roles of users. All users connect together into server, process individual functional calls and obtain results from the server.

Architecture

NATS API is run in client-server mode with communication using Java RMI technology. NATS Server is capable to serve multiple function calls. Each communication session is independent so NATS Server can provide response back to the original client respectively. The diagram here illustrates the basic concept of how NATS Client and Server interact with each other. As the diagram describes, users of NATS API utilize Python, MATLAB or Java to create the client-side programs. The actual jobs happen on NATS Server to realize all computation logic.

The work flow of operations of NATS can be seen as below. When the server is started, it can accept commands from outside. The communication windows fall on server-side and client-side based on same protocol rules. User's programs, like Python, triggers the action at the step 1. NATS Client program handles the action requests and send them to the corresponding windows on the server. NATS Server is responsible for all calculation and may output result as data files. Finally, the response data is sent from NATS Server all the way back to Client program and eventually reaches users' programs.
